com.metaio.sdk.jni

Class IAnnotatedGeometriesGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metaio.sdk.jni.IAnnotatedGeometriesGroup

  • public class IAnnotatedGeometriesGroup
extends Object
    Replacement for IBillboardGroup which places geometries at their real location. Replacement for IBillboardGroup which places geometries at their real location. Additionally manages their selection via focusing the most central geometries in the camera image. Furthermore, annotations are managed for each geometry.Note the difference between the terms "geometry" and "annotation" throughout the method names. "Geometries" are the geometries placed in 3D space (e.g. at a POI's LLA coordinates), while annotations' positions are determined by the implementation and aligned in 2D screen space.

      • getAnnotationForGeometry

        public IGeometry getAnnotationForGeometry(IGeometry geometry)
        Get annotation currently associated with a geometry. Not thread-safe. It is recommended to not call this while other SDK functions are called (such as rendering).
        Parameters:
        geometry - Geometry for which to retrieve the associated annotation Associated annotation, or NULL if none associated or if geometry not contained in the group

      • removeGeometry

        public void removeGeometry(IGeometry geometry)
        Removes geometry from the group. Caller is responsible for destroying both the geometry and its annotation (which is not used anymore by this class after this call) after calling this method!
        Parameters:
        geometry - Geometry to remove

      • setBottomPadding

        public void setBottomPadding(long value)
        Sets padding to add between bottom of viewport and bottom row of annotations. This is helpful if you want to add user interface elements to the bottom of the viewport.
        Parameters:
        value - Absolute padding in pixels

      • setConnectingLineColorForGeometry

        public void setConnectingLineColorForGeometry(IGeometry geometry,
                                              int red,
                                              int green,
                                              int blue,
                                              int alpha)
        Sets the color for the line connecting geometry and annotation (for a certain geometry only).
        Parameters:
        geometry - Geometry for which to set the connecting line's color
        red - Red component in range [0,255]
        green - Green component in range [0,255]
        blue - Blue component in range [0,255]
        alpha - Alpha component in range [0,255]

      • setDefaultConnectingLineColor

        public void setDefaultConnectingLineColor(int red,
                                          int green,
                                          int blue,
                                          int alpha)
        Sets the default color for the line connecting geometry and annotation. The color is used for all geometries added in the future.The default is (255, 255, 255, 240).
        Parameters:
        red - Red component in range [0,255]
        green - Green component in range [0,255]
        blue - Blue component in range [0,255]
        alpha - Alpha component in range [0,255]

      • setMaximumNumberOfAnnotatedGeometries

        public void setMaximumNumberOfAnnotatedGeometries(int count)
        Sets maximum number of geometries to annotate at once (counting them all together, independent of number of rows etc.) Note that this shouldn't always be the same number because of different screen sizes.
        Parameters:
        count - Maximum number of geometries to annotate at once (use -1 or any value < 0 to reset to SDK default i.e. calculate number based on viewport size and display density)

      • setMaximumNumberOfAnnotationRows

        public void setMaximumNumberOfAnnotationRows(int count)
        Sets maximum number of geometries to annotate at once (counting them all together, independent of number of rows etc.) Note that this shouldn't always be the same number because of different screen sizes.
        Parameters:
        count - Maximum number of rows for annotations (use -1 or any value < 0 to reset to SDK default i.e. calculate number based on viewport size and display density)

      • setSelectedGeometry

        public void setSelectedGeometry(IGeometry geometry)
        Sets the selected geometry. There can only be one selected geometry - or none.This call will immediately trigger IAnnotatedGeometriesGroupCallback::onFocusStateChanged. If there was a selected geometry, its state changes from EGFS_SELECTED to either EGFS_FOCUSED or EGFS_UNFOCUSED. The newly assigned selected geometry (if any) will change its state to EGFS_SELECTED.If the geometry is already selected, this method does nothing at all (no callback triggered).
        Parameters:
        geometry - Geometry that should be the selected one, or NULL to deselect any existing selection. This must be the same geometry pointer as passed into addGeometry (not the annotation instance!).

      • triggerAnnotationUpdate

        public void triggerAnnotationUpdate(IGeometry geometry)
        Triggers an update of the annotation of the specified geometry (e.g. if location changed and annotation text or information needs to be changed)May be implemented asychronously, i.e. the annotation update callback will only be called from the next update() call instead of immediately. (But: Method is not thread-safe.)
        Parameters:
        geometry - Geometry whose associated annotation should be updated
